alert.note: Alert for Ferry; Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 29 at 6:59PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Central and Northeast Washington, including the following counties, in North Central Washington, Okanogan. In Northeast Washington, Ferry. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding in poor drainage and urban areas. Debris flows are also possible in steep terrain, especially recent burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Steady moderate to locally heavy rain tonight into Wednesday will lead to continued potential flooding in poor drainage and urban areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
